positive.review:
my review of this game
This is a PvP deckbuilder with a Xianxia cultivation flavor. You keep drawing tons of cards, you try to pick good synergies, and then you hope your build survives other players’ builds. The whole “Sub-Profession” + “Immortal Fates” thing basically lets you go into weird sub builds, and the variety is kinda the main fun here. Sometimes a rare card or “fortune” completely changes your line, and it feels good to slam some cursed build that nobody expected.
what’s fun
lots of random card options → you can do many different decks
strong flavor if you like Chinese cultivation themes
fighting real players = you get surprised often
the “Fate” bonuses can completely flip your strategy mid-run
what’s not great
– sometimes it feels like pure RNG wins you games
– not beginner friendly: you need to know combos or you get deleted
– balance is “questionable” (in a deckbuilder this chaotic it’s normal tho)
verdict
really good if you enjoy theorycrafting, synergies and making cursed card engines.
not so good if you need fairness and tight balance.
7.5 / 10 (fun, but a bit random / messy — you need to enjoy that chaos)

This humble cultivator has wandered countless realms of pixel and code, yet Yi Xian shines like a tempered spirit treasure amid a sea of trash-tier trinkets. If you wish to cultivate wisdom, patience, and the art of beating strangers with righteous smugness, this game is the perfect furnace for your dao.

Underrated auto battler.  Worth trying.

If you are into auto battlers and are initially turned off by the look, I was as well, and regret not trying it sooner.  There are a ton of different viable build and basically every character feels viable.  For getting started reference the deck builds they provide and choose some of the easier characters, then move onto the more complex ones.

The English translation for the game is a bit scuffed.  This bothers some people, but personally i don't care.  The explanation is generally good enough for you to get an idea, and for the others you just need to see it once or twice to understand.  If we are honest this is the case with most games anyways.
I honestly think this game has potential to beat tft and hearthstone battlegrounds. I highly encourage people to play this game. Everyone of my friends love it.

my review of this game
This is a PvP deckbuilder with a Xianxia cultivation flavor. You keep drawing tons of cards, you try to pick good synergies, and then you hope your build survives other players’ builds. The whole “Sub-Profession” + “Immortal Fates” thing basically lets you go into weird sub builds, and the variety is kinda the main fun here. Sometimes a rare card or “fortune” completely changes your line, and it feels good to slam some cursed build that nobody expected.
what’s fun

strong flavor if you like Chinese cultivation themes

what’s not great
– sometimes it feels like pure RNG wins you games
– not beginner friendly: you need to know combos or you get deleted
– balance is “questionable” (in a deckbuilder this chaotic it’s normal tho)
verdict
really good if you enjoy theorycrafting, synergies and making cursed card engines.
not so good if you need fairness and tight balance.
7.5 / 10 (fun, but a bit random / messy — you need to enjoy that chaos)

Can be both addicting and frustrating at times especially when a strong meta is defined for the season and not following or building to counter it is almost a guaranteed lose. Best as a casual game you don't take too seriously. But one thing this game shines is the monetisation system. You will unlock all characters easily and cards are not locked like other games where you have to buy packs. It is unlocked from the very beginning. This means any wins or losses is your skill and luck, NOT your credit card swiping prowess.

This humble cultivator has wandered countless realms of pixel and code, yet Yi Xian shines like a tempered spirit treasure amid a sea of trash-tier trinkets. If you wish to cultivate wisdom, patience, and the art of beating strangers with righteous smugness, this game is the perfect furnace for your dao.
